title: Diary of a reluctant MEP: Brussels is like being trapped in a dystopian Disneyland
text:
In his EU diary, direct from the heart of Brussels, Brexit Party MEP John Longworth reflects on the absurdities of life in the European Parliament

Here I am again at the EU Parliament but not this time at the “death star” in Strasbourg, instead in the Disneyland that is the Brussels Parliament building, a fine edifice just off the Place Luxembourg eateries, themselves packed with EU officials chomping on the largesse of the taxpayer.

Yes, the taxpayer - that is you and me dear reader - has just suffered the Parliament rubber stamp in a vote in the Plenary session in favour of increasing the EU budget to € 1.3 trillion euros, despite my colleagues and I voting against it. That’s over a million,...
description: In his EU diary, direct from the heart of Brussels, Brexit Party MEP John Longworth reflects on the absurdities of life in the European Parliament
